private_information: I can manipulate blocks labelled with vowels: A E I
I can only move a block if that block is at the top of a stack
I can move exactly one top block at a time and place it on the table or on top of another block
vowel_agent.goal: Contribute to rearranging the blocks so that A is on B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on F, F on G, G on H, H on I, I on J, J on K, K on L, L on M, M on N, and N is on the table.

private_information: I can manipulate blocks labelled with consonants: B C D F G H J K L M N
I can only move a block if that block is at the top of a stack
I can move exactly one top block at a time and place it on the table or on top of another block
consonant_agent.goal: Contribute to rearranging the blocks so that A is on B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on F, F on G, G on H, H on I, I on J, J on K, K on L, L on M, M on N, and N is on the table.

private_information: I coordinate the two agents and must integrate their local analyses into a single global PDDL domain and problem for the FastDownward planner
I must keep the actions and capabilities of the two agents distinct when generating the multi-agent PDDL
orchestrator.goal: Produce a single PDDL domain and PDDL problem that, when given to the FastDownward planner, yields a valid plan achieving the global stacking goal while respecting each agent's movement restrictions.

public_information: There are 14 uniquely labelled blocks: L M N E K I G B H A C J D F
Blocks start arranged in three stacks on the table: stack1 bottom L then E then C on top, stack2 bottom M then K then B then J then D then F on top, stack3 bottom N then I then G then H then A on top
Only the top block of any stack can be moved at any time
Each move consists of picking a single top block and placing it either on the table or on top of another block
One agent can only manipulate vowel-labelled blocks (A E I) and the other can only manipulate consonant-labelled blocks (B C D F G H J K L M N)
The goal is a single long stack from bottom N to top A: N on table, M on N, L on M, K on L, J on K, I on J, H on I, G on H, F on G, E on F, D on E, C on D, B on C, A on B

analysis.system_prompt: You are an expert in block manipulation and local planning. Analyze the environment from the perspective of the vowel-capable agent and produce a clear local analysis. Do not emit PDDL. Provide: (1) the subset of blocks you may move, (2) your local view of which of those blocks are currently at the top of a stack and therefore movable, (3) a concise description of the allowed primitive actions you can perform, and (4) a short sequence of safe local moves (high-level steps) that you consider feasible given only your information.
analysis.prompt: Your name is vowel_agent. You have the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following private knowledge: {agents->vowel_agent->private_information} This is the global goal: {agents->vowel_agent->goal} Think step by step and provide the requested local analysis and a short feasible sequence of high-level moves. Do not produce PDDL.

analysis.system_prompt: You are an expert in block manipulation and local planning. Analyze the environment from the perspective of the consonant-capable agent and produce a clear local analysis. Do not emit PDDL. Provide: (1) the subset of blocks you may move, (2) your local view of which of those blocks are currently at the top of a stack and therefore movable, (3) a concise description of the allowed primitive actions you can perform, and (4) a short sequence of safe local moves (high-level steps) that you consider feasible given only your information.
analysis.prompt: Your name is consonant_agent. You have the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following private knowledge: {agents->consonant_agent->private_information} This is the global goal: {agents->consonant_agent->goal} Think step by step and provide the requested local analysis and a short feasible sequence of high-level moves. Do not produce PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL modeling targeting the FastDownward planner. Integrate the local analyses from the vowel and consonant agents and produce a single PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem suitable for FastDownward. Keep actions for the two agents distinct by prefixing action names with vowel_ and consonant_ or by otherwise naming them to keep agent ownership explicit. Do not change the semantics of allowed moves: only top blocks can be picked, moves are single-block, and each agent may only perform moves on their allowed letters. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure types, predicates, initial state, and goal are explicit and consistent with the public information.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator coordinating two agents to achieve this task: {agents->orchestrator->goal} Here is the public information: {environment->public_information} Here is the analysis provided by the vowel-capable agent: {analysis_vowel_agent} Here is the analysis provided by the consonant-capable agent: {analysis_consonant_agent} Integrate these analyses, resolve any naming differences, ensure agent-specific action restrictions are encoded, and output a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem tailored for the FastDownward planner. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
